sentence: The unemployment rate has been near half-century lows for well more than a year, the pace of job gains has been solid, and wages have been rising.
label: LABEL_1

sentence: These strong labor market conditions have underpinned solid household spending, which has been the key driver of economic growth over the past year.
label: LABEL_1

sentence: At the time of our FOMC meeting in January, prospects for continued economic growth remained favorable, and we judged that monetary policy was well positioned to support that outlook.
label: LABEL_1

sentence: The outbreak has also disrupted economic activity in many countries and has prompted significant movements in financial markets.
label: LABEL_2

sentence: The virus and the measures that are being taken to contain it will surely weigh on economic activity both here and abroad for some time.
label: LABEL_0

sentence: In response, we have eased the stance of monetary policy to provide some more support to the economy.
label: LABEL_0

sentence: As always, our actions are guided by our congressional mandate to promote maximum employment and price stability.
label: LABEL_1

sentence: And I fully expect it will return to solid growth and a solid labor market as well.
label: LABEL_1

sentence: You saw this morning’s G-7 statement of finance ministers and governors, and I think that statement does reflect coordination at a high level in the form of a commitment to use all available tools, including health-care policy, fiscal policy, and monetary policy as “appropriate.” So, in terms of fiscal policy, again, not our role.
label: LABEL_2

sentence: We have—we have a full plate with monetary policy.
label: LABEL_2

sentence: But there’s also a role for monetary policy.
label: LABEL_2

sentence: Monetary policy can be an effective tool to support overall economic activity.
label: LABEL_2

sentence: So, on your first question, we’re always going to set monetary policy at a given time in a way that we think best serves our dual-mandate goals, and it’s as simple as that.
label: LABEL_2

sentence: So, you know, we’ll—if we get to a place where we think it’s an appropriate time to change March 3, 2020 the stance of monetary policy, we won’t hesitate to do that.
label: LABEL_2
